captions.text:
STEVE SPANGLER: So today I'm
on a quest to find out what
floats and what sinks.
I'm Steve Spangler.

And I'm all about making
science fun.

For the last 20 years, I've
been teaching ways to turn

ordinary science experiments
into unforgettable learning
experiences.

I have an amazing team who will
do whatever it takes to

affect the way people
think about science.

And do that, I live
by one motto.
Make it big.
Do it right.
Give it class.

So let's find out simple
things that
will float and sink.

Dennis, it's time to
play float or sink.
Do you want to pick something?
That's perfect.
Dust remover.

I wonder-- rocket science--
what do you think?
DENNIS: Floats.

STEVE SPANGLER: Oh, you might
want to think it again.
DENNIS: Sinks.

STEVE SPANGLER: See, always
trust your first thing.

See, that's why he didn't
do well in school.
Float or sink?
What do you think?

MALE SPEAKER: Well, it's
going to sink.

STEVE SPANGLER: OK, let's
check and see.
No, you're wrong.
It floats.
You're fired.
Why don't we test this?
Your stapler, float or sink?
DENNIS: Sink.
Definitely sink.
STEVE SPANGLER: Are you sure?
You want to change?
DENNIS: Sink.
STEVE SPANGLER: OK.
Here we go.
Nope, it floats.
DENNIS: No, it doesn't.

wait, it sinks.
All right, so it sinks.

All right, so you
won that one.

All of her pens.

STEVE SPANGLER: I'm sorry.

all the pens float.
But the scissors sink.

Isn't that an interesting
thing to have happen?
All right.

I want you to get
back to work.

Yes.
It's a floater.

So I took all my lunch money,

All right, here we go.

I know exactly what

That means we need to take a

But what does that

Carbohydrates mean sugar,

And the average American

That's a lot of sugar.

And if you think about it,

It's time to weigh it.

All right, take a

389 grams for the

And it's all sugar.

But what does that

How many packets of sugar are

18 packets of sugar.

Now, let's say you go home and

That's nearly 100
packs of sugar.

So let's say that you just

365 days, what could
that do to you?

Well, after 365 days, you've

That's 32 pounds, or 14.5

And who doesn't like
a gummy bear?

You ever heard of a kid being

Well, my question is so how

Let's go figure it out.

Well, this is where we
need safety glasses.

And we're also going to need

This is where we're using

And it's just about ready

So I have gummy bears.

So these are little

And they're packed

So when you get them to a kid,

So here's what I have here
is I have this liquid.

It's not just gummy bears you

And it's a great oxidizer.
